repnme.cdata!:
Kosovo - Third Energy Sector Technical
            Assistance Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Third Energy Sector
            Technical Assistance Project for Kosovo were as follows:
            outcomes were satisfactory, the risk to development outcome
            was low or negligible, Bank performance was satisfactory,
            and Borrower performance was also satisfactory. Some lessons
            learned included: 1) a project is highly effective in
            implementation when there is a clear identification of the
            needs by the counterpart/borrower. For this project, all the
            agencies were eager to establish their institutions with the
            help of the technical assistance, and the consultants were
            fully integrated into Kosovo Transmission System Market
            Operator (KOSTT) and Energy Regulatory Office (ERO)
            operations, and the performance was good; 2) it has been
            beneficial to have the involvement of non-governmental
            organization (NGO) also in the preparation of strategic
            documents. For example, in the preparation of the mining
            strategy, it is important that the consultants financed by
            the Bank are engaged with a range of players, so that even
            if there is a change of government, the momentum is not
            lost; 3) there is a need for flexibility so that activities
            can be rescheduled or revised to reflect changing priorities
            as a new government stands-up and defines its development
            priorities; and 4) throughout project implementation the
            Bank facilitated frequent meetings and discussions so that
            the project will benefit from close cooperation among the
            donors and consultants to avoid overlaps.

repnme.cdata!:
Kosovo - Third Energy Sector Technical
            Assistance Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Energy Sector Technical Assistance
            Project for Kosovo will: (i) support KOSOVO'S
            integration with the regional energy market through
            assistance with implementation of its immediate obligations
            under the Athens Memorandum namely the establishment of an
            independent Transmission and System Operator (TSO),
            development of a Grid Code, development of transmission and
            retail tariffs including subsidy mechanism, and
            institutional strengthening to participate in the market,
            and (ii) to develop a policy framework, guidelines, and
            institutional capacity for the utilization of Kosovo's
            mineral resources. The project has the following three
            components: Component 1) comprises the following two
            subcomponents: Subcomponent 1- Transmission and System
            Operator: This includes the development of a Grid Code for
            the transmission system, drafting of a transmission policy
            framework. Subcomponent 2- Tariff Framework: Development of
            electricity transmission and retail tariffs including a
            lifeline tariff. Component 2) will comprise of the following
            three subcomponents: Subcomponent 1- Mining Sector Strategy:
            Development of a mining sector strategy and building
            capacity within PISG to implement the plan for both large
            and small mines. Subcomponent 2- Mining Sector Community
            Participation and Development Plan: Development of a policy
            framework and detailed guidelines for communication,
            participation, and preparation of development plans for
            communities that may be affected by future mining projects.
            Component 3) Technical assistance to small scale mining
            operations (SME) to improve their financial, operational,
            and environmental performance.
